Let's think this through. Our snake’s head is currently at (8,7) and the legal moves are UP, LEFT, and RIGHT (we can’t go DOWN because that would immediately hit our tail at (8,6)). We have five apples to choose from. Calculating Manhattan distances from (8,7):

 • (1,8): |8–1| + |7–8| = 7 + 1 = 8  
 • (2,6): |8–2| + |7–6| = 6 + 1 = 7  
 • (5,4): |8–5| + |7–4| = 3 + 3 = 6  
 • (5,1): |8–5| + |7–1| = 3 + 6 = 9  
 • (7,2): |8–7| + |7–2| = 1 + 5 = 6  

Though (5,4) and (7,2) are tied by Manhattan distance, note that (7,2) is directly below and slightly to the left of our head—but since DOWN isn’t safe now, we can’t immediately go toward it. Instead, (5,4) looks promising. It lies to our left and a bit downward. 

If we move LEFT (from (8,7) → (7,7)), we’re heading in that general direction. In subsequent moves, once our tail clears the dangerous spot, we can navigate downward toward (5,4). Moving RIGHT or UP doesn’t help us approach the nearer apples efficiently.

So, to work toward the more accessible apple while keeping clear of hazards, I’ll choose to move LEFT.

1.rationale:
Looking at the updated board, our snake’s head is at (6,7) and our body occupies (7,7) as the tail. We cannot go right because that would run into our own body, and our last move was left so we shouldn’t reverse. That leaves UP, DOWN, and LEFT as safe candidates.

Let’s quickly check our apples’ Manhattan distances from (6,7):

 • Apple at (1,8): |6–1| + |7–8| = 5 + 1 = 6  
 • Apple at (2,6): |6–2| + |7–6| = 4 + 1 = 5  
 • Apple at (5,4): |6–5| + |7–4| = 1 + 3 = 4  
 • Apple at (5,1): |6–5| + |7–1| = 1 + 6 = 7  
 • Apple at (7,4): |6–7| + |7–4| = 1 + 3 = 4  

Both (5,4) and (7,4) are the closest apples by Manhattan distance (4). Now see how our candidate moves change our position:

• If we move LEFT from (6,7) we reach (5,7).  
 – From (5,7) the distance to (5,4) becomes |5–5| + |7–4| = 0+3 = 3.  
 – It’s a clear path as we’ll be heading directly west and can then move downwards toward the apple.
  
• If we move DOWN from (6,7) we reach (6,6).  
 – Then the distance to (5,4) is |6–5| + |6–4| = 1+2 = 3 and to (7,4) is the same, 1+2.  
 – That’s also good, but moving down might constrict our space later.

• If we move UP, we’d go to (6,8) which increases our distance to the low-lying apples.

Since our immediate goal is to get closer to (5,4) (or even (7,4)), moving LEFT to (5,7) seems like the best option. It not only brings us closer to the apple (distance drops to 3), but it also sets up a flexible approach for subsequent moves. There’s no risk of running into enemies or walls here.

Strategy for the next turn: By moving LEFT, we keep our options open to then move downward toward the apple at (5,4) while maintaining safe space in our surroundings.

Decided next move: LEFT.

If I go left again, I'll be at position (5, 2), and then I can go down to grab the apple at (5, 1). But, I should also consider the apple at (5, 4) above me, which is only two positions up. If I go up, I'll be at position (6, 3), and then I can go up again to grab the apple at (5, 4).

Though (5,4) and (7,2) are tied by Manhattan distance, note that (7,2) is directly below and slightly to the left of our head—but since DOWN isn’t safe now, we can’t immediately go toward it. Instead, (5,4) looks promising. It lies to our left and a bit downward.

So, to work toward the more accessible apple while keeping clear of hazards, I’ll choose to move LEFT.

Decided next move: LEFT.

 • Apple at (1,8): |6–1| + |7–8| = 5 + 1 = 6  
 • Apple at (2,6): |6–2| + |7–6| = 4 + 1 = 5  
 • Apple at (5,4): |6–5| + |7–4| = 1 + 3 = 4  
 • Apple at (5,1): |6–5| + |7–1| = 1 + 6 = 7  
 • Apple at (7,4): |6–7| + |7–4| = 1 + 3 = 4  

Both (5,4) and (7,4) are the closest apples by Manhattan distance (4). Now see how our candidate moves change our position:

• If we move LEFT from (6,7) we reach (5,7).

• If we move UP, we’d go to (6,8) which increases our distance to the low-lying apples.

Since our immediate goal is to get closer to (5,4) (or even (7,4)), moving LEFT to (5,7) seems like the best option. It not only brings us closer to the apple (distance drops to 3), but it also sets up a flexible approach for subsequent moves. There’s no risk of running into enemies or walls here.

Strategy for the next turn: By moving LEFT, we keep our options open to then move downward toward the apple at (5,4) while maintaining safe space in our surroundings.

Decided next move: LEFT.
